00001 //_____________________________________________
00002 //
00003 // KEventFactory.cxx
00004 // KDataStructure
00005 //
00006 // Author: Adam Cox <mailto:adam.cox@ik.fzk.de> on 5/11/10.
00007 //
00008 // * Copyright 2010 Karlsruhe Institute of Technology. All rights reserved.
00009 //
00010 // Ideally, one would use this class whenever they want to create
00011 // some type of Event class that derives from KEvent. When 
00012 // an event class is created that derives from KEvent, the author
00013 // must make sure to declare the kEventName and the kClassName for 
00014 // their class. See the KHLAEvent and KRawEvent source files for 
00015 // an example. 
00016 //
00017 // To use this class, one simply asks the object for a new event of 
00018 // whatever type of even is needed. Also, the methods which produce
00019 // a new event are static methods, which means an instance of a KEventFactory
00020 // is not needed to use the method. 
00021 //
00022 // KDS Developer's Note: If you want the KDataReader and KDataWriter classes
00023 // to recognize your Event class, you must derive from KEvent and 
00024 // you must implement your class here. The KHLaMCEvent class (along with 
00025 // KHLAEvent and KRawEvent) is an example of this. 
00026 
00027 #include "KEventFactory.h"
00028 #include "KHLAEvent.h"
00029 #include "KRawEvent.h"
00030 #include "KHLaMCEvent.h"
00031 //#include "KMCEvent.h"
00032 
00033 #include <iostream>
00034 
00035 using namespace std;

00045 KEventFactory::~KEventFactory(void)
00046 {
00047   //Does calling clear at destruction take too much computing time?
00048   Clear("C");
00049 
00050 }

00052 void KEventFactory::Clear(Option_t* /* opt */)
00053 {
00054   //Clear the base classes and then clear/delete any local
00055   //members. Its necessary for this Clear method to exist
00056   //in the case that instances of this object are stored
00057   //inside of a TClonesArray
00058   //Also, if this class holds any TClonesArrays, it must call
00059   //TClonesArray::Clear("C")
00060 
00061   //Clear and delete local objects here. 
00062         
00063   //Re initialize local members here and prepare for the next use of this class.
00064   InitializeMembers();
00065 
00066 }

00070   //WARNING - THIS METHOD SHOULD NEVER ALLOCATE SPACE FOR POINTERS
00071   //ONLY SET MEMBERS ON THE STACK TO THEIR INITIAL VALUES
00072 }

00074 KEvent* KEventFactory::NewEvent(const Char_t* type) 
00075 {
00076         KEvent *event = 0;
00077         string sType = type;
00078         if(sType.compare(kHLAEventName)==0 || sType.compare(kHLAClassName)==0){
00079                 event = new KHLAEvent;
00080                 if(event != 0) BuildEvent(event);
00081         }
00082         else if(sType.compare(kRawEventName)==0 || sType.compare(kRawClassName)==0){
00083                 event = new KRawEvent;
00084                 if(event != 0) BuildEvent(event);
00085         }
00086         else if(sType.compare(kHLaMCEventName)==0 || sType.compare(kHLaMCClassName)==0){
00087                 event = new KHLaMCEvent;
00088                 if(event != 0) BuildEvent(event);
00089         }
00090         /*
00091          else if(sType.compare("MC") == 0){
00092          event = new KMCEvent;
00093          //do any other initialization stuff here, if needed in the future
00094          }
00095          */
00096         else {
00097                 cout << "KEventFactory::NewEvent. Invalid event type: " << type << endl;
00098         }
00099 
00100         return event;
00101 }
00102 
00103 KHLAEvent* KEventFactory::NewHLAEvent(void)
00104 {
00105         //returns a pointer to an KHLAEvent object. You own the memory, so
00106         //you must delete it.
00107         
00108         return dynamic_cast<KHLAEvent*>(NewEvent(kHLAEventName));
00109 }
00110 
00111 KRawEvent* KEventFactory::NewRawEvent(void)
00112 {
00113         //returns a pointer to an KRawEvent object. You own the memory, so
00114         //you must delete it.
00115         
00116         return dynamic_cast<KRawEvent*>(NewEvent(kRawEventName));
00117 }

00119 KHLaMCEvent* KEventFactory::NewHLaMCEvent(void)
00120 {
00121         //returns a pointer to an KHLaMCEvent object. You own the memory, so
00122         //you must delete it.
00123         
00124         return dynamic_cast<KHLaMCEvent*>(NewEvent(kHLaMCEventName));
00125 }

00127 Bool_t KEventFactory::DeleteEvent(KEvent *event)
00128 {
00129         //can use this method to delete objects if you like. This might be 
00130         //useful in the future if the objects become more complicated.
00131         
00132         //returns true if it successfully deletes the object.
00133         if(event == 0) return true;
00134         
00135         //could check for event type and perform type specific cleanup if necessary
00136         
00137   event->Clear("C"); // make sure that we clear out the event's TClonesArrays.
00138         delete event; 
00139         event = 0; //why doesn't this set event to zero outside of this method? stupid scope
00140         
00141         return true;
00142 }
00143 
00144 KEvent* KEventFactory::NewEvent(const KEvent* event)
00145 {
00146         //make a new Event object, but copy it from an already existing event.
00147         //This method checks which type of KEvent you passed in,
00148         //then creates a new Event of that type and returns a pointer. The return
00149         //here is KEvent, but you should cast that pointer to whatever
00150         //event type you really have. 
00151         
00152         //have to check the type, then call that type's copy constructur and 
00153         //return the pointer. 
00154         
00155         KEvent *mNewEvent = 0;
00156         
00157         if(event == 0) return mNewEvent; 
00158         
00159         if(const KHLAEvent *mHLAEvent = dynamic_cast<const KHLAEvent*>(event)){
00160                 mNewEvent = NewEvent(mHLAEvent);
00161         }
00162         else if(const KRawEvent *mRawEvent = dynamic_cast<const KRawEvent*>(event)){
00163                 mNewEvent = NewEvent(mRawEvent);
00164         }
00165         else if(const KHLaMCEvent *mHLaMCEvent = dynamic_cast<const KHLaMCEvent*>(event)){
00166                 mNewEvent = NewEvent(mHLaMCEvent);
00167         }
00168         else {
00169                 cout << "KEventFactory::NewEvent: Cannot create a new Event of this type" << endl;
00170         }
00171         
00172         return mNewEvent;
00173         
00174 }
00175

00177 KHLAEvent* KEventFactory::NewEvent(const KHLAEvent* event)
00178 {
00179         //make a new Event object, but copy it from event.
00180         
00181         KHLAEvent *mNewEvent = new KHLAEvent(*event);
00182         
00183         return mNewEvent;
00184         
00185 }

00208 void KEventFactory::BuildEvent(KEvent *event)
00209 {
00210         if(const KHLAEvent *mHLAEvent = dynamic_cast<const KHLAEvent*>(event)){
00211                 //do whatever is needed. nothing for now. 
00212                 if(mHLAEvent){
00213                         //do stuff. 
00214                 }
00215         }
00216         
00217         else if(const KRawEvent *mRawEvent = dynamic_cast<const KRawEvent*>(event)){
00218                 //do whatever is needed. nothing for now.
00219                 if(mRawEvent){
00220                         //do stuff. 
00221                 }
00222         }
00223         else if(const KHLaMCEvent *mHLaMCEvent = dynamic_cast<const KHLaMCEvent*>(event)){
00224                 //do whatever is needed. nothing for now. 
00225                 if(mHLaMCEvent){
00226                         //do stuff. 
00227                 }
00228         }
00229         else {
00230                 //cout << "KEventFactory::NewEvent: Cannot create a new Event of this type" << endl;
00231         }
00232 }
